Back-radiation as shown in the Trenberth Cartoon Diagram is non-physical pseudo-science. The sun warms the earth which radiates the energy to space. This thermodynamic process is irreversible.
The atmosphere does indeed radiate, but is radiating the low energy exhaust the earth produced. The incoming energy has already been used.
Atmospheric radiation does not and cannot act as heat to the earth. It does not contain the frequencies and amplitudes required to re-heat the planet. You can't re-climb the Entropy ladder. Jesus!

The alarmists claim that additional CO2 warms the earth which evaporates more water which is a GHG that warms the earth and so on..... In fact, they claim that the water causes a 3x amplification (positive feedback) and as such is the real culprit. This is poppycock. Think about it. If water in the atmosphere produced a positive feedback, the earth would be a cinder long ago.
This theory is illogical, non-physical, pseudo-science.
Turns out, satellite data shows water produces a negative feedback, not positive. Sorry guys, but factual.
Water actually moderates the planet temperature which is why this planet, covered 70% by water, remains happily pleasant.
The alarmists would never openly say that they believe water to be the culprit. Imagine the leftists crying it's the water, it's the water. They would be laughed at. So they hide the notion. Manufacturers such as GM and Ford, spending billions on battery vehicles, will be bankrupt in 5 years.

1 high energy and 1 low energy input source cannot be added together to produce a temperature higher than the highest input source. The lower energy input is ignored as it does not possess the frequencies and amplitudes of the higher energy source.
The Trenberth cartoon attempts to recycle the Earths emission and adds it to the incoming high energy emission from the sun.

To wit, heat 2 bars of iron to 150 degrees and 130 degrees respectively. Place a temp recorder near them. Initially, the recorder will read 150 degrees, not 280 as the Trenberth cartoon would indicate.The equilibrium temperature will be 140 degrees. That is the average, not the additive. This is because the 130 degree emission is wholly contained beneath the curve of the 150 degree bar. It lacks the energy to boost the 150 degree bar.

Same applies to Trenberth. Fluxes are, at best, averaged, not added.

Therefore, using the logic and arithmetic of the Greenhouse Gas Effect theory, we can boil water with two sources which individually and independently could not.
It would mean that two or more sources of radiation aimed at the same target would create a higher temperature than either of the sources could acting alone.
That’s an easily testable property of heat and heat transfer. It is not a property of Climate or Atmosphere – it is a heat-transfer property.
Show us examples, in the moderate physical world, where fluxes can be added. You cannot even if you a PhD after your name.
Per the Second Law of Thermodynamics, Q(heat transferred), varies as T4hot-T4cold. The 2nd Law "can be used to predict whether processes are forbidden, despite obeying the requirement of conservation of energy as expressed in the 1st Law”.
"The second law is concerned with the direction of natural processes. It asserts that a natural process runs only in one sense, and is not reversible. For example, when a path for conduction and radiation is made available, heat always flows spontaneously from a hotter to a colder body”. Not the cold atmosphere to the hot Earth.

Therefore the GHG “theory”, which relies on two sources (solar radiation and GHG radiation) to be summed, cannot be true.
The Earth’s surface reaches the temperature achieved by either Solar or GHE acting alone – they cannot be added together.

The Nonsense That is Ozone-Depletion

"Ozone depletion" is a car we all bought back in the 80s but never kicked the tires or looked under the hood.

"Holes" in the ozone argument:

1) Freon is heavier than air: how do molecules heavier than air get to 30,000 feet (the beginning of the stratosphere)?

2) The "hole" in the ozone over the South Pole was "discovered" by satellites in the '80: if it was just "discovered", how do we know IT WASN'T THERE ALL ALONG ? ? ? ?

3) There is a perfectly logical reason why there is less ozone over the polar regions: THERE IS LESS SUNLIGHT THERE TO PRODUCE OZONE IN THE FIRST PLACE, especially in winter ("land of the midnight sun...")

4) Antarctica (South Pole) has the highest average elevation of any continent (8000 ft): Does that have any effect on ozone quantity????? (The North Pole is all at sea level and there is no ozone "hole" there. (Why not?)

5) The offending atom is CHLORINE (very common), not CFCs themselves. The argument goes that the CFCs carry CHLORINE up to the stratosphere. There are other compounds of chlorine in the atmosphere -- that's one of the things you smell when you go to the beach --> "salt water" --> i.e. sodium-chloride. Is the ocean a source of "ozone depleting" chlorine compounds?

6) Most basic of all, ozone (O3) is an EFFECT of UV blockage, not a cause. [O3 is an unstable molecule that needs a lot of energy to produce, e.g. the ozone you smell around arcing engines. There is less ozone at the poles b/c there is less UV to generate it (just like there is less sunlight to keep the place warm in the first place.

I hope the public is beginning to see how dubious this ozone scam is. Monstrous mistakes like this DO happen - think the ban on DDT and malaria deaths.

A cold drink will only be able to regulate it's temperature as long as ice remains in the glass. This is due to the energy consumed by the ice cube before changing state, and raising above 0 degrees Celsius. The same amount of energy that causes the change of state(turns ice into water), will raise water from 1 to 80 degrees Celsius. So once the ice has been exhausted, there is a real threat of a temperature runaway. If you look at time lapse satellite pictures of the north pole you may come to the conclusion that inhabitants of the north hemisphere may come to loose the regulating ice of the north pole during the summer months in the not to distant future.

This video is less than two years old so why was it made when the writing is already on the wall. We have entered the Eddy Grand Solar Minimum. The planet is now going to get colder. Along with getting colder the earth is going to see major changes in local climates with regard to the amount of precipitation, drought and flood. What if all the ice melted? That is a stupid question since the ice in Antarctic has been there for 12 million years and it has been much warmer than now during this inter-glacial period.  The planet is at a point where we should begin to see sea levels drop. The last 100 years the average rise of sea level was 3 mm/yr. That's an 1/8 of an inch/year. Nye is an alarmist and you can bet someone is paying him to scare you. Who? I don't know. I would like to scare you too but I'll do it for free.  Here is my scary story which is a prediction based on data and real scientists. The sun has solar cycles. Solar cycle is the description of solar activity over a period of time. One of them you may be aware of is the 11 year cycle. We've been assigning numbers to the 11 year cycle and we are now presently ending solar cycle #24. They actually vary in length a couple of years. In addition to the 11 year cycles there other cycles of longer duration and sometimes they work together to control the sun's activity. John Casey identified a 206 year cycle and other have found 400, 1000, etc. Another type of cycle is the cosmic ray cycles which are dependent on three variables which filter out cosmic rays or they don't filter them. If you were to look at a chart of cosmic ray intensity you would see that right now we have gone off the top of the chart for the first since keeping tract of them. Cosmic rays affect climate, health and are also seem to have an affect on volcanic activity. Galileo was the first to keep data for sun spot activity so we have several hundred years of count sun spots. Interestingly are cool spot generally about a 1000 degrees C below the normal surface of the sun but they in turn are in the vicinity of solar flares that are millions of degrees hotter. A solar cycle is just that and they have a distorted sinusoidal shape and vary a little in frequency but also vary in amplitude based on the number of sun spots. Going back in history and comparing the number of sun spots with earth's temperature it becomes obvious that the earths temperature is in direct correlation with sun spot frequency. Going back to the Maunder Minimum you would observe that the quantity of sun spot diminished considerably and the period was called the little ice age. The same thing happens during the Dalton Minimum which was occurring late 1700's and early 1800's and during this time the north east and china and western and eastern Europe experienced the year without summer when every month had frost and ice formed on ponds in July. People died of famine. 1 billion people lived at that time but today we have almost 8 billion. When the sun is less active it's magnetic field collapses and one of the things the magnetic field does is it filters cosmic rays.  Three things that will determine the severity of the Eddy Grand Solar Minimum is Solar activity, the rate of cosmic ray bombardment and volcanic activity. That means that we don't know for certainty how extreme this cold era is or how long it will last. The people in the near future will witness crop failure after crop failure and since no countries really made an attempt at minimizing the suffering it will be world wide. Except ... the likelihood of the ice caps melting is somewhere between ZERO & NONE. They're actually gaining mass at present. Even at the vastly over estimated temperatures in the future, it would take thousands of years ... if at all. That's because the Sun doesn't shine on the polar regions during their Winter months, hence the temps are well below zero. The present ice age will probably resume long before even a small portion of the poles melt. That's if the current estimates are even partly right ... which is very unlikely. Not one of the 107 modeled temperature reconstructions (GCMs) has shown anything like accuracy. They all run hot over time ... wildly throwing off all climate predictions.

In short ... Bill Nye is a complete idiot who hasn't the vaguest idea about climate science, or he's simply a bold faced liar. Take your pick. If I had to guess, I'd say he's both.

Yes, when the climate changes and the jet stream moves, Europe may get cooler, that is what happened during the dark ages, this is all a cycle of the planet, it warms and then cools. Ocean levels will rise, or have risen. There are submerged cities off the coast of Japan, Cuba, at the bottom of the Great Lakes. Some under as much as 700 feet of water, so oceans have risen at least that much. What will happen if the ice melts, we will have another ice age, it is always going to be colder at the poles than at the equator. As Bill points out, ice is fresh water, salt in the ocean water keeps it from freezing. As ice melts fresh water mixes with salt water lowering the level of salt in the sea water and raising the freezing point. Once a threshold is reached, a super sheet of ice is the result covering a huge area and super cooling the air, then we have a global cooling period. We are warming now, the next step is a mini ice age. Al Gore had it backwards, it doesn't get cooler to get warmer, it gets warmer before it gets cooler and has since this planet was formed.

You only have about 40 sets of data. In a constantly fluctuating system that's not enough to draw any kind of conclusion from.

Trend analysis of arctic ice levels requires that you have:
1. Real energy input data (Earth's core, the Sun, Other sources)
2. Real energy loss data (potential energy, lost to space, other losses)
3. Observed changes in the system which are correlated to the data of 1. and 2.
4. From the above real world data (actually observed not inferred - no using 3 special trees in Siberia) covering hundreds of scenarios, you can then begin to build a model which may predict changes.

Bottom line, we don't have the blueprints of the solar system, we barely understand the basics of how it works, and we haven't been gathering data long enough to jump to any conclusions. I love that you're measuring these things and trying to figure out larger systems, but stop acting like you're a prophet, there is too much you don't know or understand.

Now then 101 on global warming. Pens and papers or laptops etc ready? Good then we'll begin. Please save your questions til after the lesson has ended.

Climate change is a hoax peddled by ‘gravy train scientists’. Take a list of figures remove the lowest reading and ‘voila’, global warming.
This hoax has been running and gaining traction for 40 odd years and as scientists retire and come off their reliance on grants they are now finally admitting it’s a sham. Regarding Merkels ‘The Climate action plan 2050’ fossil fuels will start to run out by then anyway providing an automatic correction to matters. Oil in 30 yrs (2050) then Gas and then coal.
For those people who want to worry with the depletion of Oil goes the way of life for developed nations, from globalisation to intensive agriculture and for the USA projection of power. Unless you can run container ships, tractors, combined harvesters, aircraft carriers, Boeings etc on batteries. A little bit more difficult to do than run vacuum cleaners.


In 2009 there was the Climategate scandal when emails from the University of East Anglia climatic research unit confirmed Dr James Hansen (a former NASA climatologist), Philip Jones, Michael Mann et al were involved in fabricating evidence of climate change. More emails followed in 2011. Meanwhile NASA had been busy fabricating data throughout 2007-2014. All this involved massaging figures, altering data sets and so on. A tweak here, a tweak there and voila you have a hockey stick.
In 2013 UN IPCC scientists reported a ‘pause’ or ‘slowdown’ in global warming in the period since 1998. In 2015 back came Thomas Karl who was director of the NCEI part of NOAA and we get the ‘pause buster’ report just in time for the UN climate conference in Paris claiming the pause/slowdown in global warming never existed and world temperatures had been rising faster than scientists expected. On the 22 April 2016 175 countries signed up to the agreement. at a cost of $1 trillion a year. Job done. Didn't any of these clowns check the facts first?

http://www.dailywire.com/news/9767/9-things-you-need-know-about-climate-change-hoax-aaron-bandler#

Dr John J Bates erstwhile colleague of the above at NCEI had a lot to say about all this earlier this year. Data sets were seriously flawed and were never approved or verified. Software was afflicted with devastating bugs giving different readings every time the same data was run; unreliable methods were used. None of the data on which the paper was based was properly archived, so no chance of the results ever being verified Oh yes and the computer used to process the software has suffered a complete failure. Whatever that means. Also when needed large adjustments to the raw data and substantial changes in successive datasets versions were made or the data was just plain ignored. I mean why not?

Bonus fact:

First off, glaciers don't melt primarily from the top down as a result of the sun's radiant heat. It melts from the bottom, up due to geothermal heat. As the top layers go thru the stages of minor melting and refreezing, its become air tight and able to trap more and more geothermal heat. As the ice melts, it falls away from the cooler glacier, creating a tiny stream that travels downhill towards the ocean. As it travels, that warmer water melts more and more glacier ice. By the time it reaches the lower levels, it has become a massive river. It's the snowball effect... Only in reverse. Water, cutting away at the base of a glacier through thermal erosion is cause of huge iceberges breaking away from the glacier. It's the ice melted from top, you'd have little - no break away iceberges. It would simply melt away.

Sea levels. Got it. But what none of these "melting polar ice" videos ever seems to talk about is how polar ice acts as a climate buffer. No ice, no buffer. In the future, New York or Tokyo might be underwater, but they could long since changed from being the climactic zones we currently associate them as being, like an Atlantic Coast that resembles a North African Coast. No ice = erratic weather snaps = crops that die = food systems collapse = we die. Moreover, as ancient ice melts, ancient pathogens thaw. These tired "rising sea level" discussions make people think the major issues in the future will be building sea walls and running the A/C and meanwhile arable land could shift fast than we're able to adapt.

São Paulo is not a "coastal" city. It has an elevation of 760m and is protected from the sea by a mountain range about twice that high. It'll never flood because of sea level rise, kids.

Something that would've been cured by some simple googling, but who has time for that, eh? Better lay on some hardcore Science™!

Four words: DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH

Do NOT rely on word of mouth. Do NOT rely on what your teacher says. Do NOT rely on Bill Nye or any celebrity or news outlet. Do NOT rely on one or two sources. (Do not even rely on a school textbook. Those can have outdated info.)

Instead of being lazy, Google it. That, or check out recent (up-to-date) material from science publications or your public library. And try to avoid biased sources.

Until people get off their lazy arses and do research to inform themselves - making up their own mind based on what they find - they should not debate controversial subjects like this. To do otherwise is to risk spreading false information and making a complete fool of themselves.

Most of all: At least consider both sides of the debate. Even if you did your research and you THINK you know what you're talking about, if you're not open to the possibility that you could be wrong, then - right or wrong - you are only espousing DOGMA.

And Global Warming IS controversial. You can argue all you want that this should not be controversial. But to claim that it is not is to ignore reality.

Hey Bill how about explaining glacial isostatic adjustment. In case you don't know, its where the weight of the ice causes the land to drop, pushing magna from below the earth's curst. At the same time, the reduced weight of water in the ocean causes them to be lighter, thus the magna below the ocean will increase pushing the ocean up. When the ice melts, the land rebounds and the ocean floor drops. IF all the ice on the earth melted, the land would rise 900 feet and the ocean would drop 100 feet. Total surface area of world: 510 million km^2

70% of world surface is ocean, therefore 510 million x 0.7 gives the total surface area of the ocean as 357 million km^2

Video says world ice is 1000m over the entire surface area of North America (24.7 million km^2). If that amount of ice was to cover the oceans instead, then 357 million / 24.7 million =14.5. In layman's terms, this means that North America sized 1km high block of ice needs to cut into 14.5 slices of even thickness in order to cover the world's oceans.

1000m / 14.5 = *69m*, which is roughly the claimed rise in sea level in the video and others.

What I want to know is does the total amount of ice account for the ice that is already in the water? And does the normal 9% volume decrease from ice to water apply as taken into account?

It is now believed that yes according to Archimedes' principle which states that any object floating in liquid is displacing its own weight of that liquid, so that when floating ice melts, it doesn't change the amount of water in the ocean. The water contained in icebergs is colder and fresh water, so the ocean and fresh water do not mix completely; the differences in density cause sea levels to rise slightly about 0.049 millimeters per year. Fresh water is less dense than salty sea water so even though the amount of sea water displaced by the iceberg is equal to its weight, the melted fresh water will take up a slightly larger volume than the displaced salt water.

Please STOP making videos with white backdrops. You’re running what may otherwise be an excellent video. This background may be okay for viewing on small devices, but not for large computer screens or TV’s.  The contrast of the white backdrop creates very uncomfortable strain on the eyes and induces migraine headaches!  And to the video directors & producers,
yes a white background might look “cool” in print medium such as photographs, magazines etc., where the ambient light controls the reflective intensity to the viewer, but not in a monitor. The monitor produces the same bright intensity at all times (unless dimmed).  
YouTube videos are increasingly viewed via streaming devices on large TV monitors, in relatively dark conditions, especially in the evening and night. Under these conditions the overwhelming contrast of the white background makes the video nearly un-watchable. This is especially true with instructional videos where one is viewing the screen as a blackboard/chalkboard

This is for Antarctica alone

data
surface area = 14 million square km~

volume of ice above sea level = 26 million cubic km~
(I noticed that you said 30 million cubic km globally)

earth radius (r)= 6370 km~

earth surface = 510 million square km (4*pi*r*r)~

ocean surface = 70% =350 million square km~
note this is about 26 times 14 million (the surface of Antarctica )~
~ = approximate

calcs

You can do this in your head.

Because Antarctica is 1/26 surface of all oceans , and has 26 million cubic km of ice, - this means each antarctic sized surface of the oceans has 1 million cubic km of (antarctic ice) associated with it. To distribute this ice uniformly you have to divide 1 million cubic km of ice over 14 million square km. (a cubic km is 1000 meters × 1000 meters × 1000 meters.)
So dividing one of these dimensions by 14 gives ~ 71 meters * 1000 *1000.

What this means is that , in the worst case , if all antarctic ice melts , all oceans will rise by 71 meters.

This does not include , - Greenland , Patagonia , Himalayas or other glaciers etc which I presume will account for the other 4 million cubic km (26/30).

What's not included here scientifically:
1. One Pole is frozen during each pole's winter (ie. -70 deg. F. at the South Pole in July, etc.) making ALL the ice on Earth to melt impossible, not to mention depth of deeper, trapped ice.
2. Even if all water-ice melted, the atmosphere would take up a large portion as way of humidity, clouds, etc., especially so if global warming is the culprit.
3. Even if all water-ice melted, a good portion would also end-up in lakes, rivers, underground areas, craters and other low-points, not just the ocean.
4. Even if all water-ice melted, water levels from the ocean and other existing sources would rise based on coastal-bank rise from shore and angle.
5. Even if all water-ice melted, levels would not be universally as-high in every ocean.
5. Since the best-possible (or worst) would be one Pole melt at a time (see #1) then all values are then cut in-half and also include options 2 through 5 as well.

We ran some scientific models and on-average, in a worst-case scenario, oceanic salinity would barely decrease noticeably, as well as alkalinity. Ocean water levels rose inland from 3 feet maximum to about 3.2 inches minimum. On a good note, however, vegetation thrived with more moisture and CO2 availability as did bio-diversity as a result (except for scant few ice-loving creatures, which migrated or had to be moved to always-cold Antarctica).

You can't hold the earth's climate where it is. It's always been changing, yes there are man-made changes occurring, but the earth has been flipping between warm periods and cold periods naturally for millions and millions of years. The Roman period was even warmer than it is today! And there were several epochs before civilizations began that were much much warmer or much much colder.

Also, Europe does an insane amount of farming in green-houses already because they need year-round food production. Also, a wetter-warmer earth could make the Saharah green again, so perhaps food production would move south, and if refuges can cross the Med with no problems, I don't think food shipments would have any problem crossing it either.

Humans would have to adapt to an ice-age, if one were coming, human's will have to adapt to a warm period if that is coming. We are much better adapting ourselves, and our own climates and micro-climtes for our needs, than trying to control the weather on a global scale. Plus, to melt all the earth's ice would take a sustained 6 or 7 + degree anomaly in the world's tempature and goverments are hoping to curb the tempature anomaly to 2 to 3 plus degrees. (C) So, it would take centuries of warming for it to become that warm, by then people could have built cities under water, or under-ground to benefit from passive cooling, just as the ants do, and people could have transformed their urban homes into floating citices Just as Veince Itally did long ago. And they could have colonized earth orbit, and both the moon and mars by then as well. Depending on the political and economic situation, the future could be even more densely populated than now, and rural areas could be mostly unpopulated. Or we might have a really big war, and than the opposite would be true, rural areas would have surivors, and the mega-cities might be left mostly in ruins.

Anyway, if scientists and engineers are worried about this, they have to be the ones providing the solutions, and they have to provide solutions that corrupt politicians can't abuse (for instance, they easily could abuse the Carbon Cap and Trade Scheme.)

This is propaganda. The video presents these events as impending disasters. But according to the IPCC, the worst case scenario predicts a 98cm rise in sea level by 2100. Assuming the rate of warming remains constant, that means it would take over 7,000 years for all of the ice on land to melt. Keep in mind that's the worst case scenario, and also keep in mind the rate of warming is not constant, but has slowed down in the past.

I'm all for being long-term oriented, but this is ridiculous. Do we really have to shape our policy around something that will happen ten thousand years into the future?

To all the people who believe climate change isn't real.

I'm not going to go try to prove it to you. You've had plenty of opportunities to look at the near-universally accepted evidence, including this video, and clearly you've decided that it's all wrong.

So I implore you to ask yourself this question, which, to be fair, I will also ask myself.

"What happens if you're wrong?"


Now if I'm wrong, and climate change is, indeed, fake, then we waste a huge amount of money switching to renewable energy (which, as a plus, reduces our consumption of foreign oil) and cause widespread fake fear that ends up not manifesting in any way.

But if you're wrong, twenty percent of the world's population is displaced. Entire islands are swallowed up by the sea. The ecosystem is ravaged and species diversity is damaged even more than it already has been. Food becomes more difficult to grow. Deadly weather-based natural disasters grow in frequency and intensity.

Which risk would you prefer to take?

If change continues to occur at the present rate, then the full results of global warming will take centuries to manifest.  However, "nature" rarely moves at a constant rate.  If some cataclysmic event affected the process, then the timetable could be accelerated to a remarkable degree.  For example, the world's largest volcano lies underwater off the coast of Antarctica in the midst of a range of ten active volcanoes. If, hypothetically speaking, one or more of these volcanoes erupted, the entire melting process of Antarctica could be accelerated tremendously.  Also -- it is conceivable that as the seas warm, the Earth's crust expands slightly, and this expansion makes a volcanic eruption even more likely.  Who knows? We live in interesting times.

The seas may very well rise more than 70 meters.
1. Antarctica land mass is 5% of the surface of the Earth
2. The ice cap on Antarctica averages a mile thick (5280 feet)
3. The oceans cover 70% of the surface of the Earth
4. .05 x 5280 feet = .7 x RISE
5. RISE = .05/.7 x 5280 feet
6. RISE = 377 feet

This is a very general "back of the envelope" calculation that totally ignores Greenland, Siberia and North America, but the result is sobering (even if it has a fairly large margin of error).

I have a couple problems with this video.

1) NASA has been measuring the size of the ice caps since 1979. Statistically thats a very very small sample size to draw any conclusions from, especially when pin pointing to a 3 month period within that 37 year window. Was there growth at any point before or within those 37 years? Most reference points for example when talking about CO2 in PPM are discussed over an 800,000 year scale. NASA has been observing ice for 0.00005% of that 800,000 year benchmark used for atmospheric CO2, further discussing a 3 months slice of that is extremely vague.

2) There have been many times in Earths history where there was no Arctic ice caps for example 65 million years ago. Back then Mean global temperatures were 6-10 degrees Celsius warmer than today, CO2 in the atmosphere was also around 3000-4000 PPM as opposed to ~380PPM today...

3) Whats with the IF of the antarctic melting? IF the planet drifts 40 million miles towards the sun it'll be a bad day for all of us, but thats irrelevant because its not going to happen... So why the fear mongering of "IF the Antarctic melts; this will happen..." The average temperature of Antarctica is -57 degrees Celsius (-71 degrees F), for it to melt you need to be above 0 C, thats a 58 degree C temperature change that has to be sustained for centuries if not a millennium to melt all that ice. If man is still around, it will have relocated within that time, its not going to happen overnight. Lets be realistic.

So people living by the coast; you'll be fine.

3) For all those that are going to start yelling about the Antarctic, this is why you should be skeptical of this video, and Bill Nye:

http://www.nasa.gov/content/goddard/antarctic-sea-ice-reaches-new-record-maximum

http://www.nasa.gov/feature/goddard/nasa-study-mass-gains-of-antarctic-ice-sheet-greater-than-losses

This is not science. It's fearmongering.

There no mention of a time frame. That's rather convenient, because the way you present the information it seems like this is some impending disaster that will happen in the near future. But even if we take the current rate of melting, it would take several centuries for all of the ice to melt, and that's assuming the rate of melting remains constant (which it hasn't in the past). Miami isn't going underwater any time soon.

There is no mention of the positive effects of global warming. This one really bothers me, because it proves you're not even following one the basic principles of science: objectivity. You can't pretend the positive effects don't exist. Global warming will lead to less climate related deaths, larger crop yields, lower energy costs, and many other benefits.

Government agencies aren't objective sources of information on this topic; they have far too much to gain personally from the global warming claim being true. Again, you're breaking the most basic principles of science in that you should never trust a biased source. If it's not appropriate to quote oil companies on the positive effects of global warming, why should it be appropriate to quote government agencies on the negative effects of global warming? Both have a conflict of interest. Only independent sources can be trusted on this topic.

Re: North pole: Most of the ice is oceanic, and as anyone with a glass of icewater knows, when the ice melts, the water level lowers because the displacement of water from the ice is greater then the amount of water generated by melting the ice. Re: South Pole: much of that ice is in fact on land, however, there is no calculable figures that suggest the coastal flood scenario will happen. While it's possible; the known changes in coastal water levels have much more to do with tectonic movement then it does melting waterways. While the popular analysis on climate change has people in a panic over 'global warming' - the fact is that there is slightly more data suggesting global cooling. While all data DOES show climate change is occurring, the theorized 10-30,000 year planetary season analysis shows that the earth SHOULD in fact continue to warm for a few more thousand years as part of it's normal cycle. Therefore it is erroneous to claim man's influence is the cause. Furthermore; even if we ignore that data, and use only the global warming figures to calculate climate change, there are three major factors of which mankind's influence is actually the smallest contributor. Geothermic conditions and cosmic conditions (especially solar) are far greater contributors to climate change then all of man's influence throughout human history. So even if environmental legislation worked, AND the entirety of every nation on the planet strictly enforced such measures, it would still have negligible effect on reducing climate change.
Perhaps the most disturbing data, is that which shows every legislation passed with the intent to save the environment thus far, has actually caused more damage to the environment. It's clear no one really knows HOW to reduce man's influence in any meaningful way to begin with, but as these facts show - even if we did, it changes nothing.
We at A.P.I. DO agree that everyone should strive to be a good steward of the land we inhabit. However, before you spend all your money converting to so-called green energy, or chain yourself to a tree in logging country, you may want to take a look at the big picture. The road to hell is paved with good intentions.

The planet goes through climate change on its own.  Read about the "Carboniferous" time period, 358-298 million years ago. It went through its own climate change. It had its own warm and glacial periods. All before humans. We have nothing to do with climate change on the macro scale. Maybe on the micro scale, but the earth quickly recovers from that. The eruption of Mt. Tambora in 1815 created a year without a summer in 1816, having freezing temperatures in June and July in the northern hemisphere. This type of event has happened many times during human history and the earth has recovered. Its inhabitants suffered, but they too recovered.  Lets work on getting countries like China and India to get their pollution emissions under control. Remember when you had a smoking section and a non-smoking section in a restaurant?  Didn't do much good, did it? The smokers air just drifted over to the non-smoking area and polluted it. China and India are the smokers. You can't have a clean world unless everyone participates. Sorry, but we do need affordable oil if you want modern living. Wind mills, solar panels and their batteries, the copper cables to carry the generated power all need fossil fuels in the manufacturing and transportation to the location of their use. And once they are used, they are removed and transported to a location to be recycled. There is a balance to be found between green energy & fossil fuels.

I almost clicked "Like" on this video. While there is some good information, the perspective is out of kilter. How?

First of all, rising sea levels creates an inconvenience, while expensive, is at least doable. Global Cooling in our current Ice Age could trigger the catastrophic end to the Holocene interglacial which could result in a drop of -12C worldwide. This could kill 99% of the people and a large percent of the land species. This because of what happens during a glacial period of the current Ice Age:
1) Once again, permanent ice could cover all of Canada, a third of USA, and a third of Europe.
2) The cold climate would displace hundreds of millions of people.
3) Ports would eventually have to be moved, because sea levels would fall.
4) Global Cooling creates more droughts, deserts and dust, just as it did last glacial period.
5) Global Cooling creates more and stronger storms, because wind is created by thermal potential. When polar cold gets closer to equatorial heat, you get more power for building storms, like the Little Ice Age storms (1588, sinking of the Spanish Armada; and the Great Storm of 1703).
6) Global Cooling forces oceans to absorb more CO2, making them less alkaline.

Climate change has been a "constant" for 4.5 Billion years. Get over it! Some changes are disruptive and uncomfortable (Global Warming), and some are downright deadly (Global Cooling in an ongoing Ice Age).

Global Warming made civilization possible 12,000 years ago. If you understand why, then you're very close to understanding why the Warming Alarmists, like Bill Nye, are full of half-truths on the topic of climate.

Global Warming is good. Cold kills; warmth promotes life. And if you think something is going to burst into flames because palm trees start growing in Greenland, you don't know climate science at all. Earth has a wonderful temperature regulator called water. Because of our oceans, temperatures have not changed more than 5% over the last few billion years. But Ice Ages are the most deadly periods. Just compare the biodiversity of Antarctica with Brazil, or the population density of Greenland with that of Java.

Look everyone! A poorly animated video, featuring Bill Nye (actor and mechanical engineer), talking about global warming. This clearly means these are all facts.

I've read a lot of comments on YouTube, and these comments definitely rank up there with the most idiotic and misinformed comments that I've ever read.

Just one example. Al Gore swore that if everything didn't totally change immediately, we would all basically be underwater in 10 years. That was over 15 years ago. How about the fact that 2015 was a record setting year for both ice growth and ice sheet size?

Here's a fun fact. Weather changes, not just from season to season, but also year to year. Winter might be extremely cold on average one year, then the next year it is extremely warm on average. This has been happening since the beginning of recorded history.

While all of you babies are crying about carbon emissions, the same companies that push carbon taxes are dumping barrels full of mercury in the river next to your house, and you don't say anything about it because you're too stupid to know the real threat.

A new NASA study says that an increase in Antarctic snow accumulation that began 10,000 years ago is currently adding enough ice to the continent to outweigh the increased losses from its thinning glaciers.

The research challenges the conclusions of other studies, including the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change’s (IPCC) 2013 report, which says that Antarctica is overall losing land ice.

According to the new analysis of satellite data, the Antarctic ice sheet showed a net gain of 112 billion tons of ice a year from 1992 to 2001. That net gain slowed to 82 billion tons of ice per year between 2003 and 2008.

Tell us, what EXACTLY is the temperature supposed to be? Should the climate EVER change? Have one or both polar ice caps ever melted to any extent in the planet's history? How can you make a reasonable temperature prediction one hundred years in the future for an entire planet?

Composting all food, paper, yard wastes. (you can do this in apartments too with indoor composters)

Recycle batteries

One day without meat
Water down wiper fluid in summer
Plastic sandwich/food containers for lunches instead of of plastic bags
Plant a tree
Hang clothes in doorway to dry.

People have always liked the idea of a great flood, it's exciting and dramatic, however the geological record shows no significant rise in ocean levels when ice caps are absent because water released from the ice caps is not trapped in the oceans. The geological record is literally written in stone. Whenever the ice caps have melted in the past the result was primarily increased rainfall, which is actually far worse.
While less dramatic than a biblical flood increased rainfall and just slightly increased temperatures vastly expands the range of tropical diseases. Tropical diseases are numerous, very nasty, and most are poorly researched because they're confined to latitudes where people are poor. It is no coincidence that modern civilization took off in colder climates where dense populations were afforded protection from the spread of disease by annual killing freezes.
And that's just for starters as it actually gets worse. All that inundation inland will be exploited by flora and fauna. Deserts will become grassland, grassland will become forest or swamp, and life will flourish everywhere, but primarily plant life. Say hello to rising oxygen levels in the atmosphere along with all that chemical's corrosive and flammable properties making the planet hostile to technology (the stuff we depend on to solve our problems) and uninhabitable for large animals - like us. On the bright side that means the species will die laughing - oxygen narcosis is a trip.

Dear Ol' Bill is not much of a science guy. If he were, he would realize that for at least 20,000 years the world has been warming up. NYC was under about 4,000 feet of ice back then, and the Great Lakes region may have been under 5,000 feet of the cold, hard stuff. Long Island and Cape Cod are the results of those long gone glaciers due to the moraines they created. The real cause of this increase in temperature is the sun. Sun spots increased, more solar radiation has been arriving and temperatures go up. Unfortunately for all the alarmists like dear ol' Bill, who believe they should control your life, they know there is nothing they can do about the sun. So they find a "plausible-impossible" scenario that too many people actually think can happen. Like Wylie Coyote running off a cliff and not falling until he realizes he is running on air. While man-made warming seems plausible, it is not the reason the earth has been warming for the last 20,000 years or so. But you can't make a living off of that, so develop a scary scenario, and rake in $ MIllions. Al Gore would be a drunken bum living under a bridge without it. BTW, in a somewhat related note, the entire world was about 2 degrees warmer about 2,000 years ago. Crops could be grown hundreds of miles further north, and 2 growing seasons allowed civilizations to flourish. Places like China had some of their most prosperous periods during that time. Warming is not the problem. But if that sun ever reduces the sun spots (and it will), there will be massive crop failures, and the famines you hear about in olden times will return. It's just that the sun operates on a cycle that is a lot longer than the 365 day cycles we are use to.

people sit in the bottom of science vessels with headphones, listening for megafauna (dolphins, whales, seals ect.) activity while the seismic blasting is done by the way, if megafauna is detected, they are not allowed to continue the sound blasts for a few days, so as to minimise the effects of sound blasting on megafauna... one of my lecturers actually worked on one when she was studying for her phd... apparently she was put on "dolphin watch" almost every day, where she literally had to sit in the hull of the ship and listen for dolphin calls, so this is actually the case. also, the information presented in this video is very selective, while it is true, it fails to present all sides of the story, like what people are already attempting to do to counteract negative effects of sea floor surveying (for example), and how important this research is to helping us understand our own planet.) although a lot of the work done on research vessels is prospecting, other research is also conducted (finding new resources, finding new species, which can be useful to medical research, studying the physics of the oceanic plates, and the water column, including the oceanic "conveyor belt" that is mentioned in the video, which is info that can be used to better predict weather patterns). we know less about our own sea floor than we do about the surface of the moon. Does anybody else realize that this guy who is supposed to be a science guru just sold you the statement "the white ice reflects light back into space and that light is absorbed by the dark ocean"? On first hear that might sound plausible, but on closer inspection seems filled with bs. Everything on earth reflects light. Every single thing on earth. Some of what he says is true, as darker things tend to be less reflective. But there is not a single thing on earth that absorbs sunlight in totality or else it would be invisible. In fact if you take a second to go to the nearest puddle of water and look into it you will curiously see what may be called by some a "reflection". Why does this water not work the way Bill Nye says it is supposed to? If you take a gander at the way your eye works, the reflection of light by objects is key to you being able to see. Most of the people in the world are highly dependent on this reflection to be able to go about their daily life. It is called seeing.

How many people think Bill Nye, the "Science Guy", actually scientifically tested and measured the photons bouncing off of ice to see if they do in fact direct back into orbit? Unfortunately there's not much we can do about any of this. We need oil. Everything we use on a daily basis uses oil in one for or another. From our fuel, to phones, health products, etc. Wind power does need oil to keep the bearings in the turbines lubricated, so they don't seize up and potentially catch fire. Yes we can create synthetics, but we need a mass scale amount. Plus a lot of this revolves around a lot of jobs. Drilling for oil and maintaining pump jacks and off shore drills, a lot of it is on the job training and only a little bit requires any bit of school, usually done in a technical college/trade school or community college. This would put a lot of people out of work. Welders, pipe fitters, maintenance workers in these places and refineries. Sure they could get jobs else where but the huge surplus of people out of work with years of experience would get priority on the new jobs, where people who went to school for it, would be out of luck until that group retires, which may take years.

All of this stuff would have a huge negative impact on the global economy and would skyrocket unemployment. Unemployment in the US is already high, don't let news outlets fool you. I've been out of work for almost 2 years now and they would consider me to be working, even though I have not collected a paycheck in a long time. Unemployment is probably around 15% or more right now if you put people who've been out of work for a year or more.

This is an indoctrination video full of fear mongering.

Yes...IF the ice sheets melted. only at current rates even the greenland Ice sheet would take about a hundred thousand years to melt. And they don't even know the SIGN of antarctic ice with certainty.

When he talks about "so they have to grow the crops somewhere else"...there are crops that grow in warmer climates already, it's what people in warmer climates eat. It's actually the opposite...colder areas that can't support crops would support them.

The closest thing to a creature that needs arctic ice is the polar bear, but they've already lived through an ice free arctic during the holocene interglacial (and before...during the previous interglacial). And Seismic blasting? You think they just run that like a radio station...blasting everywhere 24/7? And little known fact, some whales ALREADY make noise at the same intensity as siesmic blasting, insane fact, but true, some whales source sounds at 235 dB!

The reality is, sea level rise has been going on for over a hundred years and the rate over the last 100 years has been essentially constant. Go ahead, check for yourself at the official government website showing the only long term history we have, the tide gages. Click one, select linear trend, presto...you've got as many years of data as they've been gathering for that site. Some for well over 100 years. http://tidesandcurrents.noaa.gov/sltrends/ Notice, BTW...sea level rise is different everywhere. This is why satellites give a different (higher) rate, the land its self is rising and falling. Overall, the land is rising (a long term response to the loss of the ice sheets of the glacial periods) so the satellites, which record altitude, show a higher rate that is completely consistent with the seemingly different tide gage data.

I know I'm gonna get hate on this comment. And pls read the whole thing before hating (this is pretty long, sorry). The whole global warming thing is complete bs. We are releasing CO2 into the atmosphere, but compared to amount released by volcanoes and such, it is insignificant. Plus, humans have already started to control emissions. Most of the studies that support global warming are severely skewed. I used to believe all of this, but then I took psychology. Our teacher talked about how most of the studies about global warming have false data (Veritasium made a great video about this, you guys should check it out). Scientists are just human, and if they have results that indicate that dark chocolate makes you lose weight (debunked, it doesn't), the study is more likely to be published. Many researchers than skew data to get published, because that is their source of income. They sometimes do get those results, but with either a small population or biased variables. And often times, these researchers will not replicate any of these studies because they know the results they got were due to random chance or other confounding variables. This trend with global warming is very similar. When studies say that 99.98% of scientists agree with global warming, they are lying. Let's say that 1% disagree, 87% think no affect is happening, and the rest agree. Well these "studies" group together all the 87% and 12% under supporting global warming, even though they weren't. I think last year, the Artic Ice caps actually froze twice as much as before (or something like that, you should Google it, don't take my word), setting records. The polar bear was used as publicity to support global warming. In fact, polar bears can swim up to 100 miles at a time, so they are in no danger of drowning due to melting ice caps.

Great question this "What if all the ice melted on Earth?". But it leaves a bit of science out of the discussion. Bill Nye the "science" guy kind of skips over one important factor - time. A back-of-the-envelope calculation using climate-change warming numbers gives you the better part of a millennium to melt all of this ice.

A lot of places have changed over the past 1000 years. A lot of people and animals and plants have moved during this time. A warming planet may have cause for concern, but you shouldn't lose sleep over misleading hype.

What they don't tell you. Sea ice melting is of no consequence to rising sea levels. Do the experiment for yourself. put ice cubes in a glass of water measure the waters level. After the ice all melts measure it again and notice the difference. I could tell you the results here but as it's often said seeing is believing.
Land based ice is a different story all together. if most or all the glaciers, Antarctica and Greenland ice covers were to melt it would truly be a disaster. The good news is that even The IPPCC's worst case prediction of 3° C temperature rise will not even get you close to melting the Antarctic ice cover. The average anual temperature in Antarctica is a balmy - 40°F. Ice melts at 32°F. That's a roughly 70° temperature rise which would be needed to start melting the land ice. In other words if it ever gets hot enough to melt all the land traped ice on Earth rising sea levels won't matter much to life on earth because there won't be any life left on earth. it's
funny to me that people throughout the U.S. subscribe to the channel
that tells them the earth is warming, and the ocean is rising. People
who live down here don't seem to notice the rising part. Many homes
here were built so that high tide comes
within 1 ft of the top of their sea walls. If the tide changes, they
notice. When the storm just came through, the water swelled a bit.
That we notice. Hurricanes, tropical storms, and tsunamis are quick on
the mind. Science says the ocean has risen 1/10 of an inch per year the
past 30 years. The shell mounds on the islands built by the natives
are said to have taken 2000-3000 years to build. There is one on West
Part Island, and a large one on nearby Cottage Key. Cottage Key has
been built up about 30-40 ft above sea level by this shell mound. Atop
the mound sit a couple of 500+ year old banyan trees. All of this is a
sign that the ocean level around the islands is such that they have
always been shallow spaces with little rise above the ocean... at least
for the last 2500-3500 years. So if the sea is rising now, I still
don't anticipate it covering an island that rises as much as 4 ft above
sea level. A home would likely be built 15 ft above sea level on
risers, and have wooden walkways onto the island like the dock pictured.
